intro: Romulea corsica var. neglecta, commonly known as the Corsican romulea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of delicate, pinkish-white flowers in late spring. The plant is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
